signals.title: UN forecasts subdued global economic growth at 2.7% for 2026, below pre-pandemic levels
signals.summary: The UN's World Economic Situation and Prospects 2026 report predicts global growth at 2.7%, below 2025's 2.8% and the pre-pandemic average of 3.2%. Subdued investment, limited fiscal space, and trade tensions constrain economic activity, raising concerns of a persistently slower growth path. Regional forecasts show uneven recovery with India leading at 6.6% while EU slows to 1.3%.
signals.implications: Signals a structural shift toward lower global growth potential, requiring businesses and governments to adapt strategies for a prolonged period of subdued economic expansion

signals.title: China strategically cuts tariffs on 935 items targeting high-tech and green sectors
signals.summary: Effective January 1, 2026, China reduced import duties on 935 items below Most-Favored-Nation rates, focusing on advanced technology, renewable energy, and healthcare. The strategic tariff cuts include intelligent bionic robots and bio-aviation kerosene, signaling emphasis on technological self-sufficiency and green transition while maintaining preferential treatment for 34 RCEP trading partners.
signals.implications: Indicates China's strategic pivot toward selective market opening to secure critical inputs for industrial upgrading while deepening economic ties with developing nations

signals.title: Supply chain cyberattacks surge 61% in 2025, expected to double in 2026
signals.summary: Everstream Analytics' 2026 Annual Supply Chain Risk Report reveals cyberattacks on logistics providers increased 61% in 2025 (213 incidents vs. 132 in 2024), a 965% increase since 2021. At current trajectory, attacks are expected to double in 2026. The report warns of overlapping high-probability disruptions from trade regulations, extreme weather, and aging critical infrastructure, with at least one multi-billion-dollar disruption expected.
signals.implications: Represents a paradigm shift where supply chain volatility becomes the new normal, requiring fundamental restructuring of global logistics networks and cybersecurity investment

signals.title: US labor market shows historic weakness with only 584,000 jobs added in 2025
signals.summary: December 2025 employment report shows only 50,000 jobs added, with annual job growth of 584,000 - the weakest since 2003 outside recession years. Unemployment fell to 4.4% but 85% of year's job gains occurred in first four months. Long-term unemployment (27+ weeks) rose to 26%, signaling structural labor market challenges despite low headline unemployment rate.
signals.implications: Signals potential structural weakening of US labor market despite low unemployment, raising questions about economic resilience and consumer spending capacity

signals.title: Federal Reserve Governor Miran pushes for aggressive 150 basis point rate cuts in 2026
signals.summary: Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran argues for more than 150 basis points in rate cuts during 2026, citing manageable inflation and labor market concerns. This contrasts with market expectations of only 16% odds for a January cut. The internal Fed split emerges as current rates stand at 3.50%-3.75% after three consecutive 25bp cuts, with Trump expected to announce Fed chair selection soon.
signals.implications: Reveals deepening divisions within the Federal Reserve on appropriate monetary policy stance, creating uncertainty for financial markets and business planning

signals.title: Venture capital funding projected to surge 10-25% in 2026, driven by AI dominance
signals.summary: Global venture capital deployment expected to increase from low $400B to high $400B, representing 10-25% growth versus 2025. AI startups capture 65% of US VC deal value and 37.1% of non-life-sciences first financings. Bifurcation emerges with AI-driven companies commanding significantly higher valuations while non-AI competitors struggle. Defense tech and robotics identified as emerging hot sectors.
signals.implications: Indicates extreme capital concentration in AI sector, potentially creating bubble conditions while starving other innovation areas of funding

signals.title: US Senate schedules dual crypto regulation markup sessions for January 15, 2026
signals.summary: Senate Banking Committee and Senate Agriculture Committee schedule simultaneous markup sessions on January 15, 2026 for crypto market regulation legislation. California's Digital Financial Assets Law takes effect July 1, 2026, requiring licensing for digital asset businesses. Industry experts estimate 50-60% chance of market structure bill passage before November midterms.
signals.implications: Signals potential end to regulatory uncertainty in crypto markets, which could trigger institutional capital inflows or exodus depending on final framework

signals.title: EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism enters full operation covering five major industries
signals.summary: The EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) officially entered full operation on January 1, 2026, covering steel, cement, fertilizer, aluminum, and electricity imports. This represents the world's first major carbon border tax, fundamentally changing trade dynamics and potentially triggering retaliatory measures or similar mechanisms in other jurisdictions.
signals.implications: Marks beginning of carbon-based trade regime that could reshape global supply chains and force decarbonization across international manufacturing sectors

signals.title: Trump administration delays furniture and pasta tariffs, signals year of enforcement
signals.summary: US delayed tariff rate increases on upholstered furniture, kitchen cabinets, vanities, and Italian pasta set for January 1, 2026 for additional year. Trade experts predict 2026 as 'year of enforcement for customs and tariff-related matters' following increased resources for trade enforcement agencies. Supreme Court tariff case looms with significant implications for presidential trade authority.
signals.implications: Reveals continued unpredictability in US trade policy while signaling heightened enforcement focus that could disrupt existing supply chain arrangements

signals.title: Bank of Japan expected to implement two rate hikes in 2026, first likely in January
signals.summary: Analysts expect Bank of Japan to welcome signs of reflationary success with two interest rate hikes during 2026, with first increase likely in January. This would mark continuation of Japan's historic shift away from decades of ultra-loose monetary policy, with significant implications for global carry trades and yen-denominated assets.
signals.implications: Could trigger unwinding of massive yen carry trades, creating volatility in global financial markets and affecting funding costs worldwide
